servinfo.title: Vacuum Tank Assembly Inspection (For J20 Engine)

attention2.ptxt: Do not apply vacuum more than –86 kPa (– 12.47 psi); otherwise intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve and vacuum tank could be damaged.

servinfosub.title: Intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect connector from vacuum solenoid valve.
Check resistance of intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve.
If resistance is as specified, proceed to next operation check. If not, replace intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve.

spec.title: Resistance of intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve

s1.ptxt: Disconnect vacuum hoses (1 and 2) from intake manifold tuning valve and vacuum tank.
With connector disconnected, apply vacuum (–53 kPa (– 7.69 psi) to –67 kPa (–9.72 psi)) to hose (2).
With connector disconnected, apply vacuum to hose (1). Air goes into nozzle (2).
Connect 12 V-battery to intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve terminals. In this state, apply vacuum to hose (2). Air goes into hose (1).
If check result is not as described, replace intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve.
Connect vacuum hoses to intake manifold tuning valve and vacuum tank.
Connect intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve connector securely.
Check outside of vacuum tank for damage visually.
Disconnect vacuum hoses from intake manifold and intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve.
Check vacuum passage of vacuum tank for clog and leakage as follows by using vacuum pump.

s2.ptxt: When applying vacuum (– 53 kPa (– 7.69 psi) to – 67 kPa (–9.72 psi)) to hose (1), vacuum is maintained (there is no leakage): [A]
When applying vacuum to hose (2), vacuum is not maintained: [B]
If check result is not described, replace vacuum tank assembly.

s1.ptxt: Connect vacuum hoses to intake manifold and intake manifold tuning vacuum solenoid valve.
